column1: Autlán de Navarro is a city and its surrounding municipality of the same name in the Costa Sur region of the southwestern part of the state of Jalisco in Mexico. At the Mexican census of 2005
column2: the city had a population of 53
column4: the population had increased up to approximately 108
column6: including all its delegations. The municipality has a surface area of 962.9 km². It is 192 kilometers away from the Guadalajara metropolitan area and 165 kilometers from Manzanillo
column7: Colima. This department capital is the most populated and largest city of the Costa Sur region. It is a leader district in the region since
column8: Autlán is an important commercial exchange center. In September 12
column9: 2014 the Autlán metropolitan area was vouched for by the Congress of the Union.

column1: Two recent mayors were Fernando Morán Guzmán (2010–2012) and Fabricio Israel Corona Vizcarra (2015–2018).The name comes from the Nahuatl language
column3: water channel or water ditch) and Tlan (place of or near) and means "next to the water ditch."
